page.title: 20PLACE NAMES
page.content: Place-names supply valuable historical evidence about the inhabitants and physical character of an area in the past.{Brightlingsea}-This is derived from a SAXON name,probably meaning "BRIHTRIC'S island",evidence that this was a former island site.The Domesday Book lists it as BRICTRICESEIA. {Langenhoe}-This name refers to the long spur or ridge "HOH" of land extending down towards the R.Colne. It is of OLD ENGLISH origin.The Domesday Book lists it as LANGHOU. {Colne}-A river name of BRITISH origin. The Domesday Book lists it as COLUN. {Pyefleet}-Creek infested with gnats {Saltings}-Marshes inundated by high spring tides. {Pewit Island}-In Essex dialect the black-headed gulls are known as Pewits {Moveron's}-A surname of Norman-French origin.
